definition: thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])

sentences.english: Garnetted stock of wool or of fine or coarse animal hair.
sentences.chinese: 羊毛或動物細毛或粗毛的回收纖維。

sentences.english: Irregular spiculated ovoid mass is noted in RLL.
sentences.chinese: 右下葉見不規則的有細毛刺的卵圓形腫塊。

sentences.english: The aim was to provide the theoretical basis for genetic breeding of Aohan merino sheep.
sentences.chinese: 爲敖漢細毛羊的遺傳選育提供理論依據。

sentences.english: Fine or coarse animal hair, not carded or combed.
sentences.chinese: 未梳的動物細毛或粗毛。

sentences.english: Slightly burn away hair on lamb skin.
sentences.chinese: 用細火輕輕燒去羊皮上的細毛。

sentences.english: The pesticides stated above can be used for cont-rolling D. baccarum in large area.
sentences.chinese: 以上藥劑均可在大面積防治細毛蝽時推廣使用。

sentences.english: As he walked not a long distance with the cow, he saw a plump, soft-haired goat.
sentences.chinese: 他和牛沒走多遠，就看見一隻膘肥的細毛山羊。

sentences.english: Yarn of wool or of fine animal hair, put up for retail sale.
sentences.chinese: 羊毛或動物細毛的紗線，供零售用。

sentences.english: It has really tender leaves. The leaves have small and tiny hair.
sentences.chinese: 白毫銀針是嫩嫩的茶芽，芽上面有白色的小細毛。

definition: to form a scar/to form a scab
to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
the spongy, white pulp inside the stem of rush plants, used as a wick for oil lamps
